name: Critical Reading and Listening
description: Examines the role and responsibility of the communicator across a range of rhetorical settings extending from the private to the public sphere. Drawing on theorists such as Bordieu, Bakhtin, Eco, Fairclough, Foucault, Habermas, Lacan and Lemke for principles of discourse analysis, students learn to recognize, analyze and question the social, political, cultural, ethical and economic dynamics of "text" in order to become critical interpreters of rhetoric across a range of multi-modal, multi-medial forms. [24L]
